alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 7:06PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Scotland and western Clark Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 704 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong to severe thunderstorm near Downing, or 10 miles west of Memphis, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Memphis, Wyaconda, Rutledge, Luray, South Gorin, Granger, Crawford, Arbela, Anson, Hitt, Etna, Sand Hill, Memphis Memorial Airport, Spillman Mound, Kilwinning, Chambersburg, Ashton, Heath Memorial Conservation Area, Brock and Bible Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
